message_1: Assuming that a random sample of 1000 students was selected from a school, and their scores in math, physics, and chemistry are recorded. Find the correlation coefficient between math and physics, math and chemistry, and physics and chemistry from the given data using multivariate analysis. Round your answers to two decimal places.
message_2: To calculate the correlation coefficients between the three subjects, we need the data for the scores of the 1000 students in math, physics, and chemistry. Please provide the data or a summary of the data (mean, standard deviation, and covariance) for each subject.
